sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX

Stars: Julie Ange, William Watson, Ron Charles
üçï1st Time on YouTUBEüçï BLISTERING NEW HD RESTORATIONüçï
Dive deep into raw, unfiltered exploitation cinema with the directorial debut of Grindhouse legend Jerry Gross. This rare 1966 gem blends Southern Gothic atmosphere, corrupt law enforcement, and Civil Rights-era tension in a brutal expos√© of systemic racism and police brutality.

Starring Julie Ange, William Watson, and Ron Charles, this hard-hitting Grindhouse classic tells the story of three innocent youths falsely arrested and brutalized by racist Southern police, drawing chilling inspiration from the real-life 1964 murders of Civil Rights activists in Mississippi by the Ku Klux Klan.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

This is a must-watch if you're a fan of Grindhouse movies, exploitation cinema, Jerry Gross, or Civil Rights-themed thrillers! Perfect for fans of cult films, B-movies, and vintage indie cinema.
